comments.text:
1. Install Firebug 1.8b4, http://getfirebug.com/releases/firebug/1.8/firebug-1.8.0b4.xpi
2. http://code.google.com/p/fbug/issues/detail?id=4604 download the ce.html file
3. Open firebug on the file: url from step 2, reload
4. type a character into the box on the web page
5. increase the size of Firefox: no repaint BUG

Firebug tracing acts as if it thinks all is well. The JS code is going through the motions and it is receiving events from the UI. But the UI does not update. The resize->no repaint is just to demo that the UI is busted in a way not related to firebug.

Firebug does freeze out events but if I disable this it does not solve the problem.

The test case is using 'debugger' keyword in an DOM mutation event handler for DOMCharacterModified. That keyword triggers jsd.onDebugger
comments.raw_text:
1. Install Firebug 1.8b4, http://getfirebug.com/releases/firebug/1.8/firebug-1.8.0b4.xpi
2. http://code.google.com/p/fbug/issues/detail?id=4604 download the ce.html file
3. Open firebug on the file: url from step 2, reload
4. type a character into the box on the web page
5. increase the size of Firefox: no repaint BUG

Firebug tracing acts as if it thinks all is well. The JS code is going through the motions and it is receiving events from the UI. But the UI does not update. The resize->no repaint is just to demo that the UI is busted in a way not related to firebug.

Firebug does freeze out events but if I disable this it does not solve the problem.

The test case is using 'debugger' keyword in an DOM mutation event handler for DOMCharacterModified. That keyword triggers jsd.onDebugger

OTH, this is WFM with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0.1 ID:20110707182747 (and higher) + Firebug 1.8.3 (and higher).
